title: New York Today: New York Today: A Plethora of Pancakes
text:
Traditionally, before Lent begins, observers indulge in things they’ll give up for the next six weeks, Dr. Brown told us. 
Advertisement Continue reading the main story “You get rid of your eggs, butter and fat the night before Lent begins,” he explained. “ Pancakes are the convenient way of dumping all that stuff into one pot.” Dr. Brown’s church will be holding its annual pancake dinner tonight at 274 Fifth Avenue, by 30th Street, or you can swing by suppers on Staten Island , the Upper East Side and the Upper West Side , or in Downtown Manhattan , Brooklyn and Westchester . “Shrove Tuesday is about self-indulgence, Lent is about self-denial, and Ash Wednesday, in between the two, is about self-assessment,” Dr. Brown added. 
Advertisement Continue reading the main story If a stack of syrup-soaked carbohydrates doesn’t quite satiate you, we’ve included more citywide Mardi Gras festivities below. And if you’re observing Lent, we’d love to know: What are you giving up, and why? Share your response in the comments below, or email us at . We may contact you for possible inclusion in an article. 
Advertisement Here’s what else is happening: Weather Take your pancakes on a picnic: It’s mostly sunny with a high of 58 . On the flip side, a little drizzle could splatter us later today, with heavier rain tonight. In the News • Mayor Bill de Blasio is set to introduce a plan to open approximately 90 homeless shelters. Advertisement • The City Council might consider a bill that requires the Education Department to release data on where students live, and how many applications each school receives. [ New York Times ] 
Advertisement • The state will substantially increase the rent subsidies it provides to low-income families with children in the city. [ New York Times ] • At least seven Jewish community centers in the tristate region were evacuated because of bomb threats. [ NBC ] 
Advertisement • The Bronx may soon have a general-interest bookstore again. [ DNAinfo ] • President Trump, and the fear of falling tunnel tiles.
